title: feat(core): the restarting policy can be overridden via configuration for each actor.
body:
`RestartParams` have been added for `RestartPolicy::always(..)` and `RestartPolicy::on_failure(..)`. 
The linear backoff has been replaced with an exponential approach, with a configurable limit for restarts.

BREAKING CHANGE: The default RestartPolicy is set to `RestartPolicy::never()`, `RestartPolicy::always` and `RestartPolicy::on_failure` have args .

title: fix(network): unrouted network requests on the remote node don't lead to the caller getting stuck
fix(configurer): panic at the actor restart with valid configs
fix(telemeter): restart on error
body: Sent error message to proper group.

title: fix(core): forget tokens in duplicated envelopes
fix(configurer): avoid race condition with configs on startup
fix: make lookup_vtable available without network feature
feat: support deserialization of AnyMessage
fix(logger): properly filter tracing-log entries
fix(core/supervisor): pre-spawn actors in Multicast to avoid deadlock
fix(network): notify the request sender on response decoding error
fix(network): notify remote actors if request parsing failed
fix(network): include protocol and name in decode errors
feat(network): lz4 compression
fix(configurer): block on waiting for the first message
feat(init,configurer): allow to check configs without starting the system
fix(network): ignore connections from the node to itself
body:
`alice` example with the following config:
```toml
[system.telemeters]
sink = "Prometheus"
address = "0.0.0.0:9100"

[system.dumpers]
path = "example.alice.{class}.dump"

[system.network]
listen = ["tcp://127.0.0.1:9200"]
# note that discovery is set to the same address as the listen section
discovery.predefined = ["tcp://127.0.0.1:9200"]
```

Results in the following behaviour:
```
2023-06-14 10:47:14.623828000  INFO [2478858310674023425] system.network.discovery - new connection established	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:59137	role=Unknown
2023-06-14 10:47:14.623879000  INFO [2478858310674022401] system.network.discovery - new connection established	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:9200	role=Control
2023-06-14 10:47:14.624362000 DEBUG [2478858310674022401] system.network.discovery - handshake succeeded	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:59137	elapsed=435.83µs
2023-06-14 10:47:14.624374000 DEBUG [2478858310674022401] system.network.discovery - connection to self ignored	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:59137
2023-06-14 10:47:14.624492000 DEBUG [2478858310674023425] system.network.discovery - handshake succeeded	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:9200	elapsed=478.306µs
2023-06-14 10:47:14.624502000 DEBUG [2478858310674023425] system.network.discovery - connection to self ignored	peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:9200
```

`peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:59137` is the listener ignoring the request and `peer=tcp://127.0.0.1:9200` is the discovery ignoring the request.

title: refactor(logger): configure targets in logger config
fix(configurer): send UpdateConfig as a regular message instead of a request
fix(mailbox): data race between close() and recv() methods
feat!(supervisor): discard ValidateConfig by default
dumper: revise configuration
impl Source for Option<impl Source>
feat(macros): expose macro internals
body: Expose internals of `elfo-macros` in a separate `elfo-macros-impl` crate, so downstream crates can define their own version of macros with modified path to `elfo`.

title: fix(scope): share (de)alloc bytes
fix(elfo-test): drive timers to completion
body: Previous version actually doesn't work (you can see it in stuck tests). We need to drive timers to completion in separate thread.

title: feat(elfo-test): allow specifying wait_time for recv
fix(core): remove biased from tokio::select
fix(core,telemeter): avoid directly writing metrics in allocator
fix: prevent stack overflow in AllocatorStats
feat: add AllocatorStats for tracking allocations
feat(configurer): nested config paths
